page.title: 14ARTS and CRAFTS, Blindcrake
page.content:
Traditional crafts are practised by many people in the village eg crochet, dressmaking and knitting as well as more specialised pursuits. Lace making has six followers in four families. Bobbins are made of wood or plastic wound with cotton or thread and brass pins driven through a parchment pattern. The pillow is made from a hard base and the cushion packed tightly with straw. Fly tying is popular due to the close proximity of the river Derwent. Spinning, pen and ink drawing, stick dressing and calligraphy have one or two devotees and one person maintains the village scrap book.
(See also "RECREATION-MODELS") (See also "RECREATION-HOBBIES")
